alert.note: Alert for Camp; Cass; Gregg; Harrison; Marion; Morris; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Marion, southwestern Cass, northwestern Harrison, eastern Upshur, southeastern Morris, southeastern Camp and northwestern Gregg Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cedar Springs to East Mountain. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, White Oak, Gladewater, Lone Star, Ore City, Clarksville City, East Mountain, Diana, Harleton, Cedar Springs, Avinger, Union Grove, Warren City, Lassater and Judson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Camp; Cass; Gregg; Harrison; Marion; Morris; Upshur
